title: Calories in a Half Cup of Rice

h1: Calories in a Half Cup of Rice
assumptions: Cooked white long-grain rice, no added salt, oil, or seasonings; 1 cup ≈ 158 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by rice type, brand, cooking method, water absorption, and portion measurement. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A half cup of cooked white rice provides about 103 kcal and 22 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a half cup of cooked white rice?
faqs.a: Approximately 103 kcal for a half cup (about 79 g).

faqs.q: What's the carb content in a half cup of rice?
faqs.a: Around 22 g carbs, mostly starch, with minimal fiber (0.3 g).

faqs.q: Does rice type affect calories in a half cup?
faqs.a: Yes—brown rice has fewer calories (~88 kcal) than white due to higher fiber and lower density.

faqs.q: Is this for cooked or uncooked rice?
faqs.a: Cooked; uncooked rice is much denser and higher in calories per volume.

faqs.q: How much protein in a half cup of rice?
faqs.a: About 2.1 g protein, making it a low-protein carb source.
